intro: Mappia oblonga var. elliptica, commonly known as the elliptic mappia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its elongated, elliptical leaves that are typically smooth and glossy. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from pale pink to white, often blooming in late spring to early summer. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation in warm climates.
